quote: Commander Riker to Ensign Crusher.
scene: 2    INT. SICKBAY LAB - CLOSE ON A TEXTBOOK

quote: Go ahead....
scene: 2    INT. SICKBAY LAB - CLOSE ON A TEXTBOOK

quote: Forget to set your alarm, Wesley?
Uh, yessir. I'm... very sorry.   I'll be right there.
I didn't think you'd want to miss   this.
Captain's log, Stardate 43102.8.   We have entered a spectacular   double star system in the Kavis   Alpha sector on a most critical   mission of astro-physical   research.
scene: 5    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - VIEWSCREEN - THE DOUBLE STARS

quote: Our eminent guest, Doctor Paul   Stubbs, will attempt to study the   decay of globules of neutronium   expelled at relativistic speeds   by a massive stellar explosion   which will occur here in a matter   of hours.
scene: 5    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - VIEWSCREEN - THE DOUBLE STARS

quote: It is virtually a   once-in-a-lifetime opportunity   as dictated by the forces of   nature. But frankly, Doctor   Stubbs seems much calmer about   it all than those of us who are   simply charged with the   responsibility of delivery and   observation.
scene: 5    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - VIEWSCREEN - THE DOUBLE STARS

quote: Ensign, our position....
scene: 5    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - VIEWSCREEN - THE DOUBLE STARS

quote: Approaching ten million kilometers   from the neutron star...
scene: 5    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - VIEWSCREEN - THE DOUBLE STARS

quote: Slow to one third impulse power...
scene: 5    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - VIEWSCREEN - THE DOUBLE STARS

quote: Spectacular, isn't it, my young   friend?
scene: 5    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - VIEWSCREEN - THE DOUBLE STARS

quote: Yessir.
scene: 5    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - VIEWSCREEN - THE DOUBLE STARS

quote: Over and over again, the intense   gravitational pull of the little   neutron star sucks up the star material   from the red giant, and   it builds up on the surface until   it explodes... every one hundred   and ninety six years. Like   clockwork. And it is but eighteen   hours away.
scene: 5    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - VIEWSCREEN - THE DOUBLE STARS

quote: Eighteen hours, seven minutes,   and ... ten seconds, Doctor.
scene: 5    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - VIEWSCREEN - THE DOUBLE STARS

quote: The interstellar counterpart to   Earth's "Old Faithful". The only   predictable burst of energy in   the universe that can accomplish   our goal.
scene: 5    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - VIEWSCREEN - THE DOUBLE STARS

quote: Doctor Stubbs, if you want to make   a final inspection of the unit...
scene: 5    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - VIEWSCREEN - THE DOUBLE STARS

quote: Captain, I've been inspecting the   egg for twenty years... you may   lay it when ready.
scene: 5    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - VIEWSCREEN - THE DOUBLE STARS

quote: Begin launch sequence.
scene: 5    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - VIEWSCREEN - THE DOUBLE STARS

quote: Shuttle Bay Two, stand-by to   launch the uh, "egg"...
scene: 5    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - VIEWSCREEN - THE DOUBLE STARS

quote: Standing by, Commander...
Do you know how long the   experiment will last, Wesley... ?
One billionth of a second.
Now, how would you know that?
When I heard we were going to be   part of your experiment, I read   all your published works.
Begin pre-launch sequence.
Five minutes to launch site.
Stabilize.
The ship is not responding.
Checking for failure of inertia   dampeners... Instruments say   they're working...
Captain, we're heading straight   into the path of that stellar   matter....
Shields up.
Negative. The shields won't   respond.
Impact thirty seconds.
Go to manual override to raise   shields.
Shields are rising.
Reset dampeners.
Dampeners not responding. Unable   to reset.
Reverse impulse engines.
Initiating reverse sequence.
Impact twenty seconds.
The momentum is still taking us   into the path of the   stellar matter.
Close the shuttle bay door...   Prepare for impact.
Door is frozen, Commander...
Commander Data, check all   systems... Medical personnel to   the bridge.
All systems functioning normally   again.
Computer, explanation for control   malfunction.
No control malfunction has been   recorded.
Hey, Wesley, you need some work   on your right turns...
They're running a check to find   out what happened. Everything's   okay now...
We're going into the Holodeck to   ski in Switzerland, Wes... want   to come?
Oh... I can't... I have to check   on Doctor Stubbs. He's in   Sickbay...

Wesley, I have this awkward   situation... Two gorgeous ladies,   only one of me and a terrific   program where we get snowed in   at the ski lodge... just the fire   and each other to keep us warm...       I can hold the storm for you...   meet us at the lodge later on.
I can't, Eric. There's just too   much to do...
Yeah, okay... next time.
The captain asked me to tell you   that our systems are back to   normal and we can make another   launch attempt as soon as you're   ready.
Quite a dynamic family team, you   Crushers....
It's nice to be back together.   I was at Starfleet Medical for   a year... I missed about two   inches of him.
I'm not sure I'd want my mother   to be flying through space with   me... no, I take that back. I   am sure. I wouldn't want her.   I love her dearly you understand.
Does that hurt?
My mother's a formidable woman   too. A woman of letters.       A great critic.
I know.

Good Lord, son. You didn't read   that unauthorized biography too...       I totally deny the story about   the consulate's wife on Beldoron.   We were only good friends. Is   that all the boy does, Doctor,   fly the ship and read? Doesn't   he have any fun?
Sure he does...
My studies keep me pretty busy.   I'm trying to get into the   Academy... I earn credits for   my work on the Enterprise... but   it's not the same as being   there...
Ready to sit up?
I am whole again, thank you,   Doctor.       Come along, Wesley, let's make   sure Humpty Dumpty is still in   one piece.
Computer, fix the food slot...
The food slot is functioning   properly.
Well, check it again...
The food slot is functioning   properly.
Deactivate food slot.
We're analyzing the engineering   systems data, Captain... so far   nothing unusual in the computer   log for that time period...
Run a level one diagnostic series.   We need a computer that's one   hundred percent to run Doctor   Stubbs' experiment.
... As well as the food slots in   Sickbay.
It seems to be working again.   For the moment anyway...
What can I do for you, Doctor?
Jean-Luc, how would you feel if   you were a seventeen year old and   the only starship officer whose   mother was on board... ?
If you're concerned about Wesley,   I see no evidence that there's   a problem.
I know. In a funny kind of way...   that's exactly my point. We talk.   We smile. It's almost too   polite.
Beverly, this is simply a matter   of time. I know how difficult   it was to be away.
Tell me about him.
He's... become a fine officer.   He works as hard as any member   of the crew... Riker says his   studies...
No, tell me about him.
He seems well adjusted...
Does he have many friends... has   he been in love... ?
Jean-Luc, he's come so far, so   fast. And since I've been back   I don't feel...
His dependence?       He is seventeen, Beverly.
What were you doing when you were   seventeen?
Getting into a lot more trouble   than Wesley is, I can assure you.
So was I.
Isn't that what seventeen is   supposed to be?
No cracks in the armor... we'll   be just fine...
How can you be so calm about   everything? If I was about to   make this kind of breakthrough...

I've never doubted for a moment   that this day would come, Wesley.   And I suspect some day it will   come for you as well. I see a   lot of me in you.       In my youth, they called me a   vunderkind... do you understand   vunderkind... ?
It's German, isn't it?
It means wonder child. It is   reserved for those of us who   achieve early in life. Now the   burden is yours.
The burden?
To fulfill your potential.       You will never come up against   a greater adversary than your own   potential, my young friend.
Red Alert. You should return   to your quarters immediately.
Still no visual contact?   Impossible... Mister Worf, same   magnification. Fifty degrees   starboard.
scene: 31   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - CLOSE ON PICARD (OPTICAL)

quote: Worf, you're absolutely sure...
scene: 31   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - CLOSE ON PICARD (OPTICAL)

quote: The sensors clearly indicate the   approach of a Borg vessel.
scene: 31   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - CLOSE ON PICARD (OPTICAL)

quote: Shields up.
Shields are not responding.
Manual overide is jammed. It's   not gonna work this time... we   don't have shields, Captain.
Captain, they've fired energy   weapons at us...
Evasive action.
Bring about to two-eight-five mark three.
Predict current vector of the Borg   ship.
Vector... is gone.       And so is the Borg vessel.
You're telling me this was another   computer glitch?
It is conceivable that we were   viewing a synthetically   generated image... although there   is no precedent for it.
Our computer was daydreaming... ?
Computer, identify malfunction   immediately.
Pawn to King Three... Knight to   Rook Four... Queen to Bishop   Three...
Controls are not responding.
Impulse engines are down.
Try warp engines.
Sorry, Commander... I better get   back to engineering...

Lieutenant Worf, you will   accompany Commander La Forge.   I want a full report on the   prospects for getting our shields   back. Commanders Data and Riker   will join me in the conference   room to consider the future of   this mission... if there is one.
The fact of the matter is we're   dealing with a potential breakdown   of our main computer...
That's hard to accept.
The system automatically provides   for self-correction, Captain.   There has not been a system-wide   technological failure on a   starship in seventy-nine years.
Excuse me, Captain, Doctor Stubbs   has been waiting to see you. I   think it might be wise if...
Captain, I'm sure you have   everything under control, I'd just   like to know what's going on.
Of course, Doctor. Sit down.       Counselor...
Commander La Forge is attempting   repairs as we speak...
"Attempting" ... that doesn't sound   particularly reassuring.
Doctor, if it is at all possible,   we will continue this mission as   planned.
Captain, if we miss our chance   now we don't get another for two   centuries. There will be many   questions asked by Starfleet if   the Enterprise fails in its   duty...
Nevertheless, my first and   foremost concern will be to insure   the safety of this ship and its   crew...
Insure the safety, Captain or are   you really talking about playing   it safe?
My dear Doctor, in our current   position, when that star explodes,   you'll get to watch your   experiment from the inside out.
I would rather die than leave.
I don't believe you speak for the   majority, Doctor.
Doctor Stubbs, I know how much   this means to you...
My dear Counselor, no insult   intended but please turn off your   beam into my soul. I will share   the feelings I wish to share...
Lieutenant Worf to Captain Picard.
Captain, all weapons systems are   down.
Estimated time for repairs?
Commander, I don't even know what   to repair yet.
Continue to advise.
Well, if we do not take our leave   in time, so be it... it's one sure   way into the history books, eh?
His nonchalance is studied and   practiced...
Even my sensory perception picked   that up today...

In fact, he's put his entire self-worth   on the line with this   experiment. He is telling the   truth when he says he'd rather   die than leave.       And one more thing... he doesn't   like women very much.
Odd. The research material on   Doctor Stubbs includes not a few   references from gossip columns.   It suggests females find him quite   attractive.
Not this one.
What happened to you?
We had a little accident on the   Holodeck....
On the Holodeck... but it's   programmed to prevent injuries...
I was making a great run down a   deserted slope when the ground   just seemed to fall away....
Engineering, this is Doctor   Crusher. The Holodecks are to   be closed by my order until   further notice.
We've been having control problems   today. There's a small fracture   here... this'll just take a   minute...
You look like you could use   something warm inside you... hot   chocolate, maybe?
Wes almost came along. It's   probably a good thing he didn't.
I didn't know he was going skiing   with you...
It was one of those last minute   things... we tried to grab him   on the way...
We don't see much of him now that   he's been assigned to the bridge.
Omigod....
What happened...
He's not breathing...
If he had been alone, he would   have died.
Advise everyone to remain in their   quarters when not on duty.   Protocol "B" access to all power   components. Nobody else uses them   unless it's cleared by Commander   Riker.
Sir, is it possible this is not   a computer breakdown?       What if it is some form of attack?
Our sensors showed no sign of life   in this stellar system.
They also showed a Borg vessel   that did not exist. Counselor   Troi?
I perceive no life force,   Captain... no feelings of ill   will. But I am not attuned to   every form of life.
Data, stay on the sensors... see   if we can't pick up something   out there.
It does almost seem as if   something... or someone is trying   to render the Enterprise helpless.
They're not just trying, Number   One. If it's true, they're doing   a damn good job of it.
You got it. Nice going, Geordi...
Call up the cross-section of   computer core processor   four-five-one, elements   zero-two-hundred through   zero-three-hundred.
In order to get some power, I had   to by-pass the computer core and   essentially hotwire the   connection.
Look at that lesion. No wonder   we're coming apart at the seams.
It's some kind of continuing   disintegration. But from what... I   can't tell ya. And I haven't the   slightest idea how to stop it.
But it's just a mechanical   problem, right?
Increase magnification, factor   fifty.
I don't know, Wesley. Looking   at it... if it weren't...   impossible... I'd say someone had   climbed in there and started   taking it apart.
Guinan... I didn't think anyone   would be here.
I've never been very good at being   confined to quarters. Any of my   husbands would testify to that.
What are these things?
I'm just setting... traps.
I run a clean place here.
I know. It's not that. I just...
Guinan, I'm scared. Everything   that's been going wrong may be   my fault.
Pull up a stool, Wesley.

I've been working on my final   project for Advanced Genetics.   It's on nanotechnology. And I've   been studying the nanites we have   in the Sickbay genetic supplies.   They're just like tiny little   robots with gigabytes of   mechanical computer memory, tiny   enough to enter living cells and   conduct repairs. They're supposed   to be strictly confined to the   lab.
Are you trying to say some nanites   are on the loose?

Two of them. That's all. See,   I just wanted to see how they   would interact and function in   tandem. In my project, I had   proposed a theory that they could   actually combine their skills to   improve their usefulness. And   it was working.
You made a better nanite.
I was pulling an all-nighter to   get my final data... and I fell   asleep. When I woke up, I   realized the container was still   open...       It was just a science project.
A doctor once said the very same   thing to me... what was his   name... Frankenstein, I think.
They're really harmless. They   only have the most basic skills.   It's almost impossible that they   could be responsible...
Almost.
Doctor Crusher to Wesley Crusher.
Go ahead.
I stopped by your quarters, Wes.   I assumed you'd be there, since   you're off duty.
I was just... I had some things   to do...
Orders are orders, Mister Crusher.
You won't tell anybody...
I know. I will. If it's true.
Wesley...       Think you'll get a good grade?
I always get an A.
So did Doctor Frankenstein.
Captain's log, supplemental. Our   computer core has clearly been   tampered with and yet there is   no sign of a breach of security   on board.

We have even considered sabotage,   but Counselor Troi has not   detected any such sentiments.   We have engines back and will   attempt to complete our mission...   but without a reliable computer,   Doctor Stubbs' experiment is in   serious jeopardy.
Manual restart sequence?
Manual restart successful...   impulse engine functions appear   normal.
Proceed.
Shuttle Bay Two, open hangar   doors.
Doors did not respond. Repeating   sequence.
What in heaven's name... ?
It is "Stars and Stripes Forever"   by John Phillip Sousa, a popular   American composer of band music   in the early twentieth century...
Yes... yes... I know...
Computer, shut off the music....
The music is on all communications   channels, Captain.
Power... weapons...   communications. We're being   stripped one system at a time...
Shut off the power to the bridge.
I feel no hostile emotions   present. No friendly feelings   either. Nothing.
Only an enemy without honor   refuses to show himself in battle.
We may be fighting a different   kind of enemy than we've ever   known... an enemy that fights a   war of nerves.       Resume power to the bridge.
Commander La Forge, can you get   us out of this star system   safely...
No...
Not now, Doctor.
I'll try, Captain. I don't want   to overload the engines...
Do it gently. But do it.
We'll circuit in auxiliary power   to the bridge... and find some   way to silence Sousa if he tries   an encore.
The priority is to find out who   or what is doing this and why.
(Riker acknowledges,     EXITS)   Those of us not involved in that   detail should get a few minutes   rest. Commander Data, the bridge,   or what's left of it, is yours.
The egg that Stubbs laid.
Nobody will say that...
Nobody will say... anything,   Wesley. We will not even be   mentioned.
I could live with failure.   ... Well, maybe not. But never   even to try. To miss your one   chance at bat. Do you know   baseball?
My dad taught it to me when I was   little.

Once, centuries ago, it was the   beloved national pastime of the   Americas, Wesley. Abandoned by   a society that prized fast food   and faster games. Lost to   impatience. But I have seen the   great players make the great   plays.
Do you recreate them on a   Holodeck?

No, in here...       With the knowledge of   statistics... runs, hits and   errors... times at bat... box   scores. Men like us do not need   Holodecks, Wesley. I have played   seasons in my mind. It was my   reward to myself. For patience.   Knowing my turn would come. Call   your shot. Point to a star. One   great blast and the crowd rises.   A brand new era in astro-physics.   Postponed one hundred and   ninety-six years on account of   rain.
We have to talk.
You really look like you could   use some rest...
I know. It's okay. Really.
No, it's not. Really.
I'm just checking some traps that   I set... to see if I can find out   what's happening to the ship.
On someone's orders... ?
We're running out of time for   Doctor Stubbs...
Wesley, you can't put everything   on your own shoulders. Even when   you're off duty, you're on duty...
Mom, you don't understand...
You're a seventeen year old boy...
I'm an acting officer... I have   responsibilities....
I'm beginning to think... maybe   we're all expecting too much of   you.
I've done everything anyone has   asked of me and more. You don't   know... you haven't even been   here.
I'm here now, Wesley.
C'mon, I'll help you finish this   up... what are you looking for?
Wesley... ?
Mom, I think I've made a horrible   mistake.
Nanites. Tiny machines built from   the atom up.
Designed to have exposure only   to the inside of nucleii during   celluar surgeries. Until then,   they are kept tightly confined   in a non-functional state.
These are not ordinary nanites.
No, these have... evolved.
Evolved... how does a machine   evolve...
It's true. I'm reponsible. I   allowed two of the nanites to   interact for my school project   to increase their capabilities.   And... they escaped.
School... project...
Just how far have these things...   evolved?
This is a sample of linear memory   crystal from our computer core.
It's like candy to them...
They're now capable of   mechanically replicating   themselves. And who knows what   else....
It is conceivable that with each   new generation they enhance their   own design. The rate of evolution   would be...extraordinary.
How many generations are we   dealing with here?
Engineering, display computer   core processor four-five-one,   element zero-two-nine-nine.
Increase magnification, factor   one thousand.
A few.       Can it be possible that they know   what they're doing...
Why would they attack us?
Why does a mosquito bite your ear   and who cares? The answer is   simple. Call an exterminator.
Doctor Stubbs, these nanites are   apparently operating with a new   collective intelligence... working   together, teaching each other   skills...
Doctor, are you suggesting they   are becoming a... civilization?
Oh really. I'm sorry but this   is nonsense. You can't have a   civilization of computer chips.   They're made in a plant in Dakar   Senegal. I've watched the   construction.
Then how do you explain what   you've seen here?

It's no more mysterious than   watching a strain of the Leutscher   virus reproduce itself. And that   at least is a bona fide lifeform.   How many disease germs and viruses   have you destroyed in your time,   Doctor Crusher?
I cannot exterminate... something   that "may or may not" be   intelligent.
My good Captain...
There is still time.       Ensign Crusher, work with Data   to find some way to remove them   safely. If things get worse,   we'll take stronger measures.
Gentlemen. I need a computer   functioning perfectly in less   than eight hours... and we still   have core reconstruction to   consider...
We're testing a low level gamma   field that might reduce their   processing speed.
Have you considered a high level   charge?
High level gamma radiation would   kill them, Doctor Stubbs.
I know.
Doctor Stubbs...
I can't get the story of David   and Goliath out of my head. How   long do we wait, Number One?
We can continue to bypass parts   of the computer that are   affected... but if these nanites   are spreading all over the ship...
Do you smell a change in...
Picard to La Forge...   enviromental system malfunction   on the bridge... acknowledge...
Nitrogen oxide... toxic levels...
I've switched to manual control   of the air handling system...
He entered a computer access   room and sterilized one of the   processors with gamma radiation.
The nanites in the upper core   are all dead, Captain.
You have no choice now... it is   a matter of survival.
If you were a member of my crew,   sir, I would...
But I am not a member of your   crew, sir... I am a representative   of the highest command of the   Federation... which has directed   you to perform my experiment...
If one man, woman or child on my   ship dies because of your   experiment... I will have your head   before the highest command of the   Federation...
Good Lord, you are talking about   machines with a screw loose.   Simply turn them off. And be done   with them.

Doctor Stubbs, your own actions   have provided evidence to the   contrary. After you destroyed   the nanites in the core, they   immediately responded by   interfering with our life-support   systems.
It is hard to accept these as   random actions by machines with   "loose screws". In effect, you   may have proven that the nanites   do have a collective intelligence.
Captain, I'm feeling a vague   presence. It wasn't there before.   It is not hostility... More like   a primitive sense of   self-preservation.
If they have evolved this   far... into emotional growth... how   can we destroy them now?
The ship is at risk.   Extermination may be the only   alternative left.
A good point...
Lieutenant Worf, Doctor Stubbs   is to be restricted to his   quarters until further notice.
Data, can you find me a way to   communicate with these things?
With intelligence, they have the   capacity for language.
But it will depend on how far   their evolution has brought them.   We could modify the circuits in   the universal translator to make   it capable of communications with   them...
Proceed.
May I come in?
You just can't resist, can you,   Counselor?
I only want to help.

Yes, yes... to break the shell...   to get in touch with my true   feelings. What is this   preoccupation women have with   de-mystifying me? It must be the   challenge. Climb me. Because   I'm there.
I am only worried about your state   of mind, Doctor.
All right, Counselor... what is   it that has you so worried?
Your single-mindedness, your need   to have this experiment work...

But it will. Picard has no choice   now. He must defend the   Enterprise.    (tossing it all off with     a grin)   Counselor, when this is over, I   will show you New Manhattan on   Beth Delta-One as you've never   seen it and we will laugh over   glasses of champagne.
Your self portrait is so   practiced, so polished....
Yes, isn't it, though?
It is stretched so tight that the   tension fills this room. And if   you finally... fail... I fear it   will snap.
A good try, Counselor. But   sometimes when you reach beneath   a man's self portrait, as you so   eloquently put it, deep down,   inside... what you find... is   nothing at all.
Lockman on first, Dark on   second... Thompson at the plate...   Branca on the mound...
He's coming around...
I have to believe this was not   an arbitrary attack...
Has Data made any progress in   contacting them?
You must protect me. Kill them.
Commander Riker, on my signal,   we will gamma-irradiate all   computer systems throughout the   Enterprise to end this conflict.
Worf, prepare to activate gamma   pulse generators.
Electromagnetic scanners ready,   Captain.
Captain...
I have established contact.
Are you okay?
I will be. As soon as we finish   off these pests.
Wesley, do not be too harsh in   your judgment of me... until   you've walked a lifetime in my   shoes.

We are no different, you and I.   For you right now, it's getting   into the Academy. For me, it's   the egg. Others will never   understand how important our work   is to us. It's everything we live   for.
Doctor Stubbs, I want to go the   Academy. But if I don't, I have   other things to live for.
Of course you do.
They are virtually learning the   concept of communication as we   continue, Captain... each new   generation is making   modifications.
Can we actually talk to them yet?
I think it is worth an attempt...
Ask them for a cease-fire... put   it in whatever words you think   they'll understand.
Captain, their answer is... no.
Tell them it is critical to their   survival as well as our own.
Their answer is no.
I sense that after the incident   in the computer core, there is   very little trust...
Bring Doctor Stubbs to the bridge.
The universal translator has its   limits. I prefer to negotiate   eye to eye with my enemy...
I don't think there's much chance   of that here.
But they have already tried to   kill me once...
"One sure way into the history   books", Doctor...
Tell them the human who destroyed   their comrades is here and wishes   to address them...
Captain, if I might...
And you, sir will explain your   error and apologize and pray that   we can negotiate a peace we can   all live with... is that clear?
Captain, if a face to face   negotiation would be helpful,   I would like to volunteer myself   as a conduit.
Yourself, Data?
I can easily furnish the nanites   with a schematic design of my   neurological structure. Entering   my neural network would require   only their most basic skills.
That's what they were designed   for.
They could easily penetrate the   molecular fabric of my   hand-covering into the nerve   circuitry and interface with my   verbal programs.
If they have control of a   Starfleet commander, they become   an even greater threat.
How do we know we'll ever get them   out of you, Data...
There are considerable risks.   But it would also represent a   gesture of trust on our part.   It could be an important step   toward peace.
All right. Propose it to the   nanites.
The answer is yes.
They are ready, Captain.
Proceed.
You are very strange looking   creatures.
In our travels, we have   encountered many other   creatures... even stranger-looking   than we are... and all of us try   to co-exist peacefully.
The urge among us to destroy all   of your kind is intense. Why did   you attack us?
We misinterpreted your actions   as an attack against us.
We were only seeking raw materials   for our replication process.
Yes, but you endangered the vessel   in which we all travel.
You almost killed a crewmember.
We meant no harm. We were only   exploring.
We understand. We are also   explorers and we mean no harm to   any life-form.
I am the one responsible for the   deaths in the computer core.
We know who you are.

I... deeply regret the incident.   I am a scientist on an important   mission. Your... your colleagues'   exploration of the core memory   put our mission at risk. I only   meant to protect a lifetime of   work from being destroyed.
(continuing; beat, for     once lost for words)   I am at your mercy.
What is "mercy"?
He asks you to forgive him. This   conflict was started by   mistakes... on both sides. Let   us end it here and now.
We agree.
I pledge to you that we will   provide any assistance you need   for your continued survival.
Thank you, but we have evolved   beyond any need for your   assistance. This vessel has   become too confining. We require   relocation.

Captain's log, Stardate 43104.7.   Doctor Stubbs has generously used   his influence to arrange the   designation of planet Kavis-Alpha-Four   as the new home of the Nanite   Civilization. Plans to negotiate   a treaty are underway.

Commander Data's neural network   has been vacated... He has been   returned to us, unharmed, and with   the help of the nanites, our   computer core has been   reconstructed in time for the   experiment...
Ten seconds to stellar blast.
We're at forty million kilometers   from the neutron star.
Hold your position.
Doctor?
Do you have any children, Guinan?
A lot.
Ever have any trouble relating   to them?
Just one.
One?
He wouldn't listen.
Well, they all go through that.
Not in a species of listeners.
Did he grow out of it?
Well, it's taken a few hundred   years or so but I've brought him   around.
How?
A mother shapes her child in ways   she doesn't even realize.   Sometimes just by listening.
Cute couple.

Now, see, that's healthy for a   boy his age. I mean that as a   doctor not just a mother. It's   good to see him having fun... with   an attractive young woman... who   obviously looks at him with   extraordinary affection...
What do you know about this girl?
